TopicTitle: Too many animations on import to Unity!

Articles.Content:
In all the tutorials I see, people import FBX into Unity and end up with precisely one animation.

Well, in my case...

Why?! I have three objects that I animate: the collider, the mesh, and the Empty of Thrust Transform.

I press I on 'position' of each of these on frame 1, then move to frame 50, drag them each down, then press I on position of each again. Export as FBX. That's all. And somehow I'm ending up with 9 clips.

How can I get the three objects use one clip?

Okay, I thiiiink I've got it.

On FBX export:

Uncheck NLA Strips

Uncheck All Actions.

Are you exporting this from blender? I did that in the beginning until some pointed out (I forget who, apologies) that Unity, at least 5.4 anyway, will work straight from your .blend file. I work on the models directly from my Models folder in the Assets subfolder, double clicking them in unity opens them in blender. I've been doing it a lot lately to retrospectively add lighting arrangements/meshes to existing parts.

A personal aside, I've struggled to get 'thrustTransform' axes from blender to play nice (especially as blender doesn't like multiples with the same name but Unity is fine with it). I make all the model stuff in Blender, animations etc, but create and parent the GameObject in Unity (in this case thrustTransform)  to the relevant mesh afterward.
